title: Paolo Gentiloni officially nominated as Italian commissioner
text:
Former Italian Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni | Andreas Solaro/AFP via Getty Images Paolo Gentiloni officially nominated as Italian commissioner EU officials say ex-PM will get an important portfolio.

Former Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni was on Thursday officially nominated as Italy's candidate for the European Commission.

“I love Italy and Europe and I'm proud of the task I have received,” the 64-year-old former foreign minister tweeted.

An aristocrat who comes from one of Rome's most important families, and who lives in the family’s palace, Gentiloni is well connected in both Berlin and Paris.

His name has been floating for days and was made official by Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte during the first Cabinet meeting of the new government, formed by the center-left Democratic Party (PD) and the anti-establishment 5Stars. The new executive was sworn in by the president earlier Thursday.

Gentiloni, fluent in French and English and with a more limited understanding of German, is poised to get an important portfolio, possibly economic affairs, as well as a vice-presidency, according to EU officials.

Rome in recent weeks has also expressed interest the competition and internal market job. Gentiloni will meet Commission President-elect Ursula von der Leyen on Friday.

The nomination was late because of the political crisis in Rome where the previous government, formed by the 5Stars and the far right League, collapsed at the beginning of last month.

Before then it was the Eurosceptic League which was supposed to come up with a commissioner candidate.
description: EU officials say ex-PM will get an important portfolio.
